intro: Mentha × timbalii, commonly known as Timbalai mint, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Mentha viridis and Mentha suaveolens. It is a perennial herb characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers in whorled clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Mentha × timbalii is valued for its aromatic leaves, which are used in culinary and medicinal applications.
